result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaneal Cross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Illegal Articles to Inmate [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 302.095(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

May not visit brother at any institution but may communicate by letters. Must reside at 3012 W Michigan Street Milwaukee, WI and may not change residence unless approve by agent. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Remaining bond to be applied to ZCI fees. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaneal Cross

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Shaneal Cross in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 
Ct 1- Withheld sentence, 2 years probation

Conditions:
Enroll in counseling
May not visit her brother, James Cross at any institution but may write letters
Serve 30 days RCJ - stayed
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge
Waive court costs
Must reside at 3012 W Michigan Street Milwaukee, WI - may not change residence unless approved by agent
No drugs / no alcohol
Take all medications as prescribed
Bond to be applied to ZCI fees and the reminder to DNA Surcharge fee
FAW
VOTE

Defendant Shaneal Cross in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Def - Req bond remain
BTC: Def to test at ZCI before noon today.

Defendant Shaneal Cross in court.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Attorney Kuehn is currently in trial in Branch 5 and not available.
BTC: Adjourn this matter for Attorney Kuehn to be present. Defendant to report to ZCI after court, test and pay fees to ZCI.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Shaneal Cross in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - Plea to Ct 1
Rights given
P - Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt Ct 1. PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Shaneal Cross in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shaneal Cross in court with attorney Pamela L. Popken.  Matthew J. Hastings for Randall Scheider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense Atty requests to withdraw. 
BTC: Motion to withdraw is granted.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant, JTR.   No contact with her brother, JC.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Shaneal Cross in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Shaneal Cross in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
